#
# Testing --ignore-dotfiles with doublestar expander
#
exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=true --show-totals text *.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 1$'

exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=false --show-totals text *.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 2$'

exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=true --show-totals text **/*.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 2$'

exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=false --show-totals text **/*.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 4$'

#
# Testing --ignore-dotfiles with golang expander
#
exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=true --show-totals --glob=golang text *.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 1$'

exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=false --show-totals --glob=golang text *.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 2$'

exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=true --show-totals --glob=golang text *.txt subdir/*.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 2$'

exec badger --ignore-dotfiles=false --show-totals --glob=golang text *.txt subdir/*.txt
stdout '^INFO: files tested: 4$'


-- .dotfile.txt --

A dotfile!

-- standard.txt --

Not a dot file

-- subdir/.dotfile.txt --

Dotfile in a subdirectory

-- subdir/standard.txt --

Not a dot file in a subdirectory
